column4: although i am not normally a flash user or developer, i find myself very much wanting to use sIFR (the font rendering widget).  sifr requres me to open and edit the distributed .fla file.  .. . . ... . does anyone know a good application to edit a (hopefully extremely basic) .fla file in ubuntu?
so far i've tried synfig studio and it doesn't seem to open .fla files
i know that there are applications that will let me save or export flash.. but i need to actually edit an .fla file since that is how sifr is distributed
What does the swf do and what do you want to change?
it's a fla, not a swf.  it's this: http://www.mikeindustries.com/blog/sifr/
The intructions on every ppa page use the GUI.
Install from the mainling kerenel "ppa" and make sure you install the header package as well.
sure, i did that already, and found that my nvidia driver wasn't available (it was a 2.6.37 kernel)
You installed the corrosponding linux-headers package as well?
One should be built automatically by DKMS.
define "automatically".  automatically when? at the moment the kernel is installed? when it boots? do i install some nvidia package
When the kernel package is installed IIRC.
ok, i installed a new kernel.  that url you gave doesn't appear to be a real ppa (if it is, i have no idea what the correct URL should be)
and, having installed the new kernel, it did not compile the nvidia driver
